item.title: Eigenvalue level repulsion
item.description: Imaging we have two matrices ${\bf A}, {\bf B}$ $\in \mathbb{R}^n$, that are both symmetric. Then, we know that both matrices have $n$ eigenvalues (multiplicity). Let’s start now, gradually morphing ${\bf A}$ to ${\bf B}$ using the following formula $$ {\bf A}[t] = (1 - t) {\bf A} + t {\bf B}, $$ where $t \in [0, 1]$. What will happen is that matrix ${\bf A}$ will have multiple eigenvalues with probability zero, given we have chosen the matrices properly from the set of all real symmetric matrices.
